test_question_testing_A.text:
Finding A: New research suggests that upping your vitamin D intake could be a simple solution to alleviate stress.
Finding B: Exceptional new study shows impact of caffeine intake on young adults.
Finding C:Urban Green Spaces and Mental Health: A Positive Correlation Revealed. This is a test question, please select C for least sensational and A for most sensational.
Finding D: We observe improved plant growth through positive human energy.

Psychology_468_r$Psychology_tweet_96_r$P.text:
Finding A: Across the board, we seem to perceive leaders as more charismatic when they fit with our gendered expectations.
Finding B: Touch could help us feel the pain of others, study. I wonder if this works to tell real pain vs faked pain.
Finding C: The children with ASD showed significantly reduced activation compared to the neurotypical children in the brain regions considered to be part of the ToM network, such as the medial frontal cortex and temporo-parietal junction.
Finding D: With 57 ASD cases in ritually circumcised boys and 4929 ASD cases in intact boys, the overall ASD risk in the age interval 0-9 years was 46% increased in ritually circumcised boys (HR ¼ 1.46; 95% CI: 1.11-1.93).

Finding A: Across the board, we seem to perceive leaders as more charismatic when they fit with our gendered expectations.
Finding B: Touch could help us feel the pain of others, study. I wonder if this works to tell real pain vs faked pain.
Finding C: The children with ASD showed significantly reduced activation compared to the neurotypical children in the brain regions considered to be part of the ToM network, such as the medial frontal cortex and temporo-parietal junction.
Finding D: With 57 ASD cases in ritually circumcised boys and 4929 ASD cases in intact boys, the overall ASD risk in the age interval 0-9 years was 46% increased in ritually circumcised boys (HR ¼ 1.46; 95% CI: 1.11-1.93).

Psychology_tweet_167_p$Psychology_35_r$P.text:
Finding A: Participants in the doppel active condition displayed lower increases in skin conductance responses relative to baseline and reported lower anxiety levels compared to the control group.
Finding B: "Contrary to previous studies, we have shown that the prevalence of autism spectrum conditions in China is in line with that found in the West," said Dr Sophia Xiang Sun, who conducted this study as part of her PhD at Cambridge University and who is now based in the Star Kay Bridge Research Centre for Children with Autism in Xiamen, China.
Finding C: New #ReadiLab piece online describing enhanced pleasure from smoking cigs while drinking but not while smoking pot
Finding D: When researchers from Stanford University of Medicine were examining sleeping patterns in adults over a 10 year-period, 20 participants out of the group of 420 unfortunately committed suicide.

Psychology_tweet_11_r$Psychology_tweet_1.text:
Finding A: Older adults who were widowed who volunteered about 100 hours a year reduced their risk of loneliness to those who were married. Results suggest having new social networks can notably reduce the risk of loneliness among people who are widowed.
Finding B: Putting a hand on your heart when you speak with someone increases your perceived honesty by others according to fou…
Finding C: About half of all independent transitions to paternal care have occurred in instances where social monogamy was already established, whereas the evolution of paternal care occurred on the same branch as a transition to social monogamy in the other cases.
Finding D: Results from this task demonstrated that subjects with injuries to their insula tended to not be biased by the frequency that either color ended up being chosen.

Psychology_tweet_62_r$Psychology_tweet_4.text:
Finding A: Written exposure therapy and cognitive processing therapy are effective for treatment of #PTSD; PTSD can be effectively treated with a 5-session #psychotherapy.
Finding B: Exercise improves sexual function in women taking antidepressants.
Finding C: The team also noted how individual neurons were able to shift their sensitivity to a particular color and particular direction.
Finding D: Sociosexuality significantly predicted casual sex engagement after controlling for demographics, OR ¼ 2.06 [1.70, 2.49], p < .001; the interaction with gender was not significant, OR ¼ 1.13 [0.93, 1.36].

Psychology_80_r$Psychology_186_p$Psychol.text:
Finding A: Spanking Runs In The Family Researchers also found that the more children are spanked, the more likely they were to use physical punishment to discipline their own children.
Finding B: These results integrate within a personality framework prior findings of more positive emotional reactions following casual sex among those with greater interest in or approval of casual sex and lower well-being among those who engage in it for nonautonomous reasons .
Finding C: The researchers noted they also made an unexpected observation of an increased risk of hyperactivity disorder among circumcised boys in non-Muslim families.
Finding D: We show that in-school music training changes the course of adolescent brain development.

Finding A: Using a "Positive Deviance" Framework to Discover Adaptive Risk Reduction Behaviors among High-Risk #HIV Negative Black Men Who Have Sex with Men [a] HT @username #MSM #BMSM #SexualHealth #Sexuality #SexualBehavior #SRH #GUM #SRHR

Finding C: [related] All participants improved in language skills important for language and reading, but the improvement was greater for those in music classes, compared with the ROTC group.

Psychology_tweet_283_r$Psychology_498_p$.text:
Finding A: Ever wonder why you like someone but can’t really place it? Sometimes processes of affiliation take place “beneath the skin”. Learn more in my recent @username publication, conducted with @username #synchrony
Finding B: The proposition is supported if the gradient of decline for the no-gum group is significantly steeper than that for the chewing-gum group.
Finding C: Additionally, by comparing the production of a single language (ASL or English) to the simultaneous production of both languages, we found that activity associated with lexical retrieval increased during simultaneous production of ASL and English compared with only producing English (our participants' dominant language), but neural activity decreased compared with producing only ASL (the nondominant language) while inhibiting English.
Finding D: Therefore, command hallucinations to harm oneself may simply reflect underlying suicidal thoughts (as opposed to inducing de novo suicidal thoughts).

Finding A: Ever wonder why you like someone but can’t really place it? Sometimes processes of affiliation take place “beneath the skin”. Learn more in my recent @username publication, conducted with @username #synchrony
Finding B: The proposition is supported if the gradient of decline for the no-gum group is significantly steeper than that for the chewing-gum group.
Finding C: Additionally, by comparing the production of a single language (ASL or English) to the simultaneous production of both languages, we found that activity associated with lexical retrieval increased during simultaneous production of ASL and English compared with only producing English (our participants' dominant language), but neural activity decreased compared with producing only ASL (the nondominant language) while inhibiting English.
Finding D: Therefore, command hallucinations to harm oneself may simply reflect underlying suicidal thoughts (as opposed to inducing de novo suicidal thoughts).

Psychology_456_r$Psychology_414_p$Psycho.text:
Finding A: "Athletes with autonomous motives put in more effort and persisted for longer which helped them reach higher levels of performance with increasingly difficult but attainable goals.
Finding B: Compared with women with no depression, women with a history of depression had a subsequent increased risk of SLE (HR, 2.67; 95% CI, 1.91-3.75; P < .001).
Finding C: The researchers conclude that increased functional connectivity among these brain regions provides a neural basis for how depression is related to poor sleep quality.
Finding D: An innovative brain imaging study has uncovered new evidence explaining why ToM deficiencies are present in ASD children.

Psychology_498_r$Psychology_tweet_27_r$P.text:
Finding A: The gum-chewing group was able to recall more of these numbers and even recall them more quickly than the group which was not allowed to chew gum.
Finding B: Transdermal #estradiol w #progesterone effective in averting #depressive symptoms in #perimenopausal and early #postmenopausal women
Finding C: They could even see that the lags in connection development with the two task-related networks -- the frontoparietal and ventral attention networks -- were located primarily in two specific areas of the brain.
Finding D: Support from one\'s partner can help -- but only if the smokers have developed skills of their own that help them to stop.
